string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

search.slidetext: engaging students with content using technology by: jennifer persaud edt110 - teaching & technology
silence your cell phone, go to a quiet place, and get ready to learn! best practices
introduction
welcome! today, you will complete an interactive lesson about how to engage learners using technology with the content they learn.

slider activity question: how do you feel about your knowledge of engaging learners using technology? directions: use the slider to slide it left or right to where you feel your comfort level is with using technology within your classroom to engage your learners. not confident somewhat confident very confident submit submit submit submit submit submit

slider debrief question: how do you feel about your knowledge of engaging learners using technology? directions: use the slider to slide it left or right to where you feel your comfort level is with using technology within your classroom to engage your learners. not confident somewhat confident very confident
what to expect this interactive lesson has a series of self-guided activities. all you will need is your laptop or device for this lesson.
introductions this is mary! she will also be here to guide you through the different scenarios with your understanding of the material.

dial activity question: how are you feeling going into this interactive lesson? average nervous directions: move the dial to show us how you are feeling so far. good excellent submit submit submit submit submit submit

dial debrief question: how are you feeling going into this interactive lesson? its okay to have different feelings going into a lesson whether you are feeling great or nervous about it. this is why we are here to help you through it! lets get started.
triggering
engaging learners through technology the big idea for this interactive lesson is to engage learners with content using technology.
engagement engaging learners is valuable to their learning of content material in class or an online setting.
technology one way to engage learners is through technology with the help of different resources, devices, and much more.

choice choice choice choice choice choice simulations simulations simulations simulations simulations simulations game-based game-based game-based game-based game-based game-based interests interests interests interests interests interests resources resources resources resources resources resources accessibility accessibility accessibility accessibility accessibility accessibility pick many activity question: what words come to mind when you think about how you engage learners through technology? directions: click the gray boxes beside the words you think most align with how we can engage learners. pick many choice activity

pick many choice debrief question: what words come to mind when you think about how you engage learners through technology? all of these choices can be useful to engage our learners with technology! choice interest game-based resources simulations accessibility
problem implications learners using technology can be difficult if not used in ways that will engage them and learn the content thoroughly.

thank you thank you for your response. continue continue continue continue continue continue question: what in your opinion do you feel is the biggest issue with using technology to engage learners? which statement activity limited access to technology activities too passive distraction to learners unreliable resources teacher-centered and not student-centered directions: drag and drop the statement in the green box provided you feel is an issue with the use of technology to engage students.

which statement debrief question: what in your opinion do you feel is the biggest issue with using technology to engage learners? all of these choices can have negative effects on learners and their engagement with content. answers will vary. limited access to technology activities too passive distraction to learners unreliable resources teacher-centered and not student-centered
using technology to engage learners engaging learners with technology can be implemented in many classrooms, content areas, and grade levels.

type response here short answer response activity question: based on the content or grade level you teach, what is something you would like to implement or work on when it comes to engaging your learners using technology? directions: in the text box to the right, write down your thoughts on the question. click submit when you are finished.

short answer response debrief question: based on the content or grade level you teach, what is something you would like to implement or work on when it comes to engaging your learners using technology? anything you shared in your response may be important for you to remember and think about as you complete this interactive lesson. answers will vary but could include how to implement devices in the classroom where to find reliable online resources hands-on strategies implementing activities effectively

learning objectives i can explain the importance of engaging learners using technology by the end of this lesson. i can provide two to three impacts of engaging learners using technology by the end of this lesson. i can provide one to two solutions in real-life examples by engaging learners with technology by the of this lesson.
exploration
access to technology to engage learners through technology, there needs to be access to it for all learners.

type response here. question: what other incentives or ways can schools incorporate technology into classrooms if they have no financial help or if students do not have that kind of access to it besides using personal cell phones? text entry response activity directions: in the text box to the left, write a solution to either problem presented in the question. click submit when you are finished.

text entry response debrief question: what other incentives or ways can schools incorporate technology into classrooms if they have no financial help or if students do not have that kind of access to it besides using personal cell phones? great responses! here are a few ideas we would like to share to the left. answers will vary but could include: 1. using computer labs within the school if provided 2. completing grants for technology 3. incorporating online videos and simulations as a whole class activity 4. free online tools/resources
teacher development with the right professional development, teachers must know how to implement technology for engaging learners.
teaching effectiveness with the integration of technology and the right training, teachers become facilitators for learners.

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue pick many activity question: what two major things are important for teachers when implementing technology? click the two phrases for the two correct answers and then click submit. learning opportunities learning opportunities learning opportunities teaching effectiveness teaching effectiveness teaching effectiveness quick responses quick responses quick responses teacher development teacher development teacher development directions: click the circles for the two correct answers and then click submit.

pick many debrief question: what two major things are important for teachers when implementing technology? click the circles for the two correct answers and then click submit. the answers are: learning opportunities teaching effectiveness quick responses teacher development
customized learning path learners achieve different learning avenues with the help of technology which allows for more engagement in learning.
interactive process the use of technology allows learners to be able to interact and be more in tune with the content they learn.
fast feedback teachers can provide adequate feedback on work with the help of technology.

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue drag and drop activity directions: drag each technological strategy/concept and place it on its description. click submit when finished. directions: drag each technological strategy/concept and place it on its description. click submit when finished. learning path allow for students to have individualized activities based on assessments/ assignments allows for students to use suggestions and strategies from teachers to relearn or move on to activities more challenging based on skill levels interaction that could include online games, simulations, or level-appropriate assignments strategies/concepts quick feedback interactive activities

drag and drop debrief directions: drag each technological strategy/concept and place it on its description. click submit when finished. the answers are: allows for students to have individualized activities based on assessments/ assignments allows for students to use suggestions and strategies from teachers to relearn or move onto activities more challenging based on skill levels interaction that could include online games, simulations, or level-appropriate assignments learning path quick feedback interactive activities
impact of technology the impact of technology in education has allowed for teaching to be more engaging in learning content for learners.

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue pick one activity question: what is an example that has had a positive impact on technology within education? click the phrase for the one correct answer and then click submit. directions: click the circle for the one correct answer and then click submit. unreliable resources unreliable resources unreliable resources passive activities passive activities passive activities intellectual thinking intellectual thinking intellectual thinking online research online research online research

pick one debrief question: what is an example that has had a positive impact on technology within education? click the circle for the one correct answer and then click submit. the answer is: unreliable resources passive activities intellectual thinking online research
integration

scenarios activities in the next slides, you will be reading different scenarios of characters who are experiencing issues within their classroom, school, or district. your goal is to provide some guidance to them with the help of using the information you learned and gathered to help these different people. we will also debrief on these scenarios to see what ideas you choose and other strategies that could be used in each scenario. lets get started!

scenario 1: click to reveal activity scenario one issue: charlie is a principal at a high school. he is trying to find ways to figure out how his staff will use the new technology and applications the district has provided for the upcoming year. click on each suggestion to see ways he can do this. scenario one issue: charlie is a principal at a high school. he is trying to find ways to figure out how his staff will use the new technology and applications the district has provided for the upcoming year. click on each suggestion to see ways he can do this. hi, my name is charlie! what are some ways i can help my staff get the training they need to learn the new technology provided and resources? suggestion 1 provide professional development days for teachers to learn and be trained about the new technology. suggestion 1 suggestion 2 allow teachers to interact with applications and use student view to get to know programs that could be used in their classrooms. suggestion 2 suggestion 3 provide staff opportunities to see what other districts and schools are using the technology or programs to get a better look at how they can incorporate these into their own classroom. suggestion 3

type response here. scenario one issue: charlie is a principal at a high school. he is trying to find ways to figure out how his staff will use the new technology and applications the district has provided for the upcoming year. choose a suggestion you believe will be beneficial in helping get started and explain why. click submit when finished. scenario 1: text response activity wow! these are some great ideas to help my staff. which suggestion do you think would be most useful to do first?

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue scenario 2: make a choice activity scenario two issue: mila is having trouble keeping up with where her students are while formally assessing them. she wants to differentiate her students' learning more based on their learning needs. what can she do to solve this problem? help her choose what would be best to help her and her students. click on the correct response and then submit. hi, my name is mila! can you help me decide on what i should do? a. use online assessment applications to collect data to help see where students are and help gear them to their learning needs to understand the content. a. use online assessment applications to collect data to help see where students are and help gear them to their learning needs to understand the content. a. use online assessment applications to collect data to help see where students are and help gear them to their learning needs to understand the content. b. keep doing what she has been using and as she does it more, it will become easier to do and she will learn to adjust to differentiate for her students. b. keep doing what she has been using and as she does it more, it will become easier to do and she will learn to adjust to differentiate for her students. b. keep doing what she has been using and as she does it more, it will become easier to do and she will learn to adjust to differentiate for her students. c. only use formative assessments once a week to narrow down heavy load grading and feedback to students. c. only use formative assessments once a week to narrow down heavy load grading and feedback to students. c. only use formative assessments once a week to narrow down heavy load grading and feedback to students.

scenario 2: make a choice activity scenario two issue: mila is having trouble keeping up with where her students are while formally assessing them. she wants to differentiate her students' learning more based on their learning needs. what can she do to solve this problem? help her choose what would be best to help her and her students. great idea! using technology would be very helpful! a. use online assessment applications to collect data to help see where students are and help gear them to their learning needs to understand the content. b. keep doing what she has been using and as she does it more, it will become easier to do and she will learn to adjust to differentiate for her students. c. only use formative assessments once a week to narrow down heavy load grading and feedback to students.

sally could allow students to complete online games or simulations to learn content. students can go through a series of events and challenges to understand or review content. sally could allow retrieving and what they need to work on skill-wise. sally could use laptops for research for projects and formative assessments to gain knowledge on what her students are retrieving and what they need to work on skill-wise. sally could use laptops for research for projects and formative assessments to gain knowledge on what her students are retrieving and what they need to work on skill-wise. sally could use laptops for research for projects and formative assessments to gain knowledge on what her students are retrieving and what they need to work on skill-wise. sally could use laptops for research for projects and formative assessments to gain knowledge on what her students are retrieving and what they need to work on skill-wise. sally could use laptops for research for projects and formative assessments to gain knowledge on what her students are retrieving and what they need to work on skill-wise. scenario three issue: sally is an elementary teacher. she wants to use the technology she has (laptops) and have students interact with them more through engagement. how can she do this? click on one response that she could implement with her students. scenario 3: make a choice activity hi, my name is sally! can you help me decide on what i should do?

scenario 3: make a choice activity scenario three issue: sally is an elementary teacher. she wants to use the technology she has (laptops) and have students interact with them more through engagement. how can she do this? click on one response so she can implement what she has with her students. great idea and a way to incorporate the technology i have. 1. sally could allow students to complete online games or simulations to learn content. students can go through a series of events and challenges to understand or review content. 2. sally could use laptops for research for projects and formative assessments to gain knowledge on what her students are retrieving and what they need to work on skill-wise.
resolution

end of interactive lesson quiz you will complete a summative quiz of five questions in the next slides to test your knowledge of this lesson. to pass the quiz you must score 80% or better. below please put your first and last name. after completing the quiz, you can download a pdf of your certificate for completing the lesson. first and last name submit submit submit submit submit submit

true true true true true true false false false false false false true or false question: technology access is important in education for all students. directions: click the circle to show if it is true or false and then click submit. quiz question 1

lecturing lecturing lecturing lecturing lecturing lecturing implementation implementation implementation implementation implementation implementation teacher development teacher development teacher development teacher development teacher development teacher development limited access limited access limited access limited access limited access limited access multiple-choice question: what is a major component for teachers and using technology in the classroom? quiz question 2 directions: click the circle for the one correct answer and then click submit.

fill in the blank question: read the statement below and fill in the blank with the correct answer. a word bank is provided for you to use. learners achieve different ___________ paths with the help of technology which allows for more engagement in learning. quiz question 3 directions: read the statement below and fill in the blank with the correct answer. then click submit. avenue learning central centered

teacher is a facilitator teacher is a facilitator teacher is a facilitator teacher is a facilitator teacher is a facilitator teacher is a facilitator more peer to peer communication more peer to peer communication more peer to peer communication more peer to peer communication more peer to peer communication more peer to peer communication passive activities passive activities passive activities passive activities passive activities passive activities teacher focused teacher focused teacher focused teacher focused teacher focused teacher focused multiple response question: what are things that allow for teacher effectiveness when using technology in the class? quiz question 4 directions: click the circles for two correct answers and then click submit.

slow passive quick many drag and drop question: the use of technology allows teachers to provide (blank) feedback for learners so they can revisit skills or move on to the next steps of content. the use of technology allows teachers to provide feedback for learners so they can revisit skills or move on to the next steps of content. quiz question 5 directions: drag your answer to the blank line and then click submit.
%textentry4% certificate of completion print print this certificate is presented to: for successfully completing the engaging learners through technology course logo

interactive lesson quiz results congratulations, %textentry4%! you received a score above 80 percent! please click the button below to go back to the results page to print off your certificate. print results print results print results print results print results print results

interactive lesson quiz results sorry, %textentry4%! you did not receive a passing score above 80 percent. please click the button below to take the quiz again. back to results back to results back to results back to results back to results back to results
conclusion
thanks and conclude thank you for participating in todays lesson on engaging learners with technology.
questions or concerns if you would like to reach out, please email engaginglearners@gmail.com.

references dangelo, c. (2018, july 9).the impact of technology: student engagement and success. technology and the curriculum summer 2018. https://pressbooks.pub/techandcurriculum/chapter/engagement-and-success/ zhu, a. (2023). navigating the digital shift: the impact of educational technology on pedagogy and student engagement.journal of education and educational research,6(1), 1114. https://doi.org/10.54097/jeer.v6i1.14131 jing liu, c. c., hannah c. kistler, s. m. d., & darrell m. west, j. b. k. (2016, july 28).mobile learning: transforming education, engaging students, and improving outcomes. brookings. https://www.brookings.edu/articles/mobile-learning-transforming-education-engaging-students-and-improving-outcomes/ schindler, l. a., burkholder, g. j., morad, o. a., & marsh, c. (2017). computer-based technology and student engagement: a critical review of the literature.international journal of educational technology in higher education,14(1), 25.

resource_data.description: Helpful and useful links and documents:

terms.term: A piece of portable electronic equipment that can connect to the internet, such as a smartphone, tablet, or laptop computer
Efforts by teachers to respond to variance among learners by varying their teaching methods.
The technological tools and media that assist in the communication of knowledge, and its development and exchange.
The degree of attention, curiosity, interest, optimism, and passion that students show when they are learning or being taught.
